result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan L. Goslawski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryan L. Goslawski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryan L. Goslawski was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: **Bond of $500.00 on file in 16CM14 and $250.00 in 16CM1 is to be applied to costs in 16CM14 & 16CT89.  Any balance is to be paid within 60 days directly to the Clerk of Courts Office.
*Comly with any follow-up treatment. *Absolute sobriety; zero tolerance.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan L. Goslawski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Bryan L. Goslawski
Current: N5934 Eighth Dr, Westfield, WI 53964 United States  (Effective: 07-12-2017)
Prior: N3813  5th Dr, Oxford, WI 53952 United States
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Bryan L. Goslawski in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
*16CM1, 16CM14 & 16CT89 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2 in 16CM14 and Ct. 1 in 16CT89.  16CM1 along with Ct. 1 in 16CM14 and Counts 2 & 3 in 16CT89 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.
Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2 in 16CM14 and Ct. 1 in 16CT89.  16CM1 along with Ct. 1 in 16CM14 and Counts 2 & 3 in 16CT89 to be dismissed.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Gumz states that there is some cash bond posted and asks that it be applied.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2 in 16CM14 and Ct. 1 in 16CT89:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
*Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge on each count
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

cash bond to be applied

16CM1 along with Ct. 1 in 16CM14 and Counts 2 & 3 in 16CT89 to be dismissed.

Defendant Bryan L. Goslawski in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM1 & 16CM14:  (MKV Clerk)
Atty Gumz states that the defendant has a case in Juneau County and would like that resolved first.  Atty Gumz asks for a trial to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial on both matters
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryan L. Goslawski in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM1 & 16CM14 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant has already received the criminal complaint in 16CM1.
  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint in 16CM14 & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea in both matters.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.

Defendant Bryan L. Goslawski in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant states that he has Atty Gumz and thought that he was going to appear today with him.   Court states that a bond hearing will just be heard today and will be set for an Initial Appearance with Atty Gumz.
Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond with conditions:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance  Initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
